forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. Southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Sunny then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 9 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As you slip into the early hours in Downtown San Francisco, you find yourself surrounded by a gentle tinge of fog, weaving its cool fingers through the streets. The overnight clouds blanket the city, cloaking it in a serene stillness that holds the promise of moisture-laden droplets, though the breeze whispers softly from the southwest. As morning gives way to day, expect a curious dance between partly sunny intervals and the erratic flirtation of rain beginning after five o'clock. The horizon will temper your expectations with temperatures hovering around a modest 62 degrees, gradually receding as the afternoon unfolds, with brisk gusts catching you off guard—upwards of 21 mph—so be prepared for nature’s playful whims.

Dress in layers that allow you to embrace both warmth and the sudden coolness of the wind. A light jacket might serve well, while a comfortable pair of shoes invites you to wander the city’s storied streets, perfect for that casual cafe crawl or a gentle promenade along the waterfront. Given the time of day, a leisurely stroll with a steaming cup of coffee or tea will be an enjoyable escape. Grab a seat outside, and allow the mist and backdrop of fog to wrap you in a moment of reflection as you watch the day slowly yield to evening.
